content.text: Write down the period of \(a\sin \frac{x}{b} +c\)
Find the value of \(a\), of \(b\) and of \(c\)
The diagram shows the graph of \(y = a\sin \frac{x}{b} +c\) for \(- 360^{\circ}\leqslant x\leqslant 360^{\circ}\), where \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\) are integers
Find the coordinates of \(B\)
Find the equation of the line \(l\), which is perpendicular to \(AC\) and passes through \(B\)
Find the area enclosed by the line \(l\) and the coordinate axes
Points \(A\) and \(C\) have coordinates \((- 4, 6)\) and \((2, 18)\) respectively. The point \(B\) lies on the line \(AC\) such that \(\overrightarrow{AB} = \frac{2}{3}\overrightarrow{AC}\)
Find the vector which has magnitude 39 and is in the same direction as \(\left(12 \atop - 5\right)\)

Given that \(\mathbf{a} = \left(\begin{array}{c}{2}\\ {- 1}\end{array}\right)\) and \(\mathbf{b} = \left(\begin{array}{c}{- 4}\\ {5}\end{array}\right)\), find the constants \(\lambda\) and \(\mu\) such that \(5\mathbf{a} + \lambda \binom{4}{6} = \mu \mathbf{b}\).
Given that \(\frac{q^{-2}\sqrt{pr}}{3\sqrt{r}\big(pq\big)^{-3}} = p^{a}q^{b}r^{c}\) , find the value of each of the constants \(a, b\) and \(c\)
Solve the equation \(3x^{\frac{4}{5}} - 8x^{\frac{2}{5}} + 5 = 0.\)
Find the value of \(a\) and of \(b\)
Using your answers to part (a), find the remainder when \(\mathrm{p}^{\prime \prime}(x)\) is divided by \(x\)

The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x) = a x^{3} + b x^{2} + 6 x + 4\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers, is divisible by \(x - 2\). When \(\mathrm{p}^{\prime}(x)\) is divided by \(x + 1\) the remainder is \(- 7\)

A curve with equation \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\) is such that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{d}x^{2}} = 6\mathrm{e}^{3x} + 4x\). The curve has a gradient of 5 at the point \(\left(0, \frac{5}{3}\right)\). Find \(\mathrm{f}(x)\)
Find the value of \(n\)
Show that \(5b^{2} = 768c\)
Given that \(b = 12\), find the exact value of \(a\) and of \(c\)
The first three terms, in ascending powers of \(x\), in the expansion of \(\left(2 + a x\right)^{n}\) can be written as \(64 + b x + c x^{2}\) , where \(n\), \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\) are constants
Show that angle \(AOC = 1.287\) radians, correct to 3 decimal places
Find the perimeter of the shaded region
Find the area of the shaded region
The diagram shows a circle, centre \(O\), radius \(5\mathrm{cm}\). The lines \(AOB\) and \(COD\) are diameters of this circle. The line \(AC\) has length \(6\mathrm{cm}\)
Find the coordinates of the stationary points on the curve \(y = \big(2x + 1\big)\big(x - 3\big)^2\). Give your answers in exact form
On the axes below, sketch the graph of \(y = \left|(2x + 1)\left(x - 3\right)^2\right|\), stating the coordinates of the points where the curve meets the axes
Hence write down the value of the constant \(k\) such that \(\left|(2x + 1)\left(x - 3\right)^2\right| = k\) has exactly 3 distinct solutions
Find the week in which Jess runs \(16\mathrm{km}\) on each of the 5 days
Find the total distance Jess will have run by the end of week 8
Jess runs on 5 days each week to prepare for a race
In week 1, every run is \(2\mathrm{km}\)
In week 2, every run is \(2.5\mathrm{km}\)
In week 3, every run is \(3\mathrm{km}\)
Jess increases the distance of the run by \(0.5\mathrm{km}\) every week
Find the common ratio of the geometric progression
Find the first week in which Kyle will run more than \(16\mathrm{km}\) on each of the 5 days
Find the total distance Kyle will have run by the end of week 8
Kyle also runs on 5 days each week to prepare for a race
In week 1, every run is \(2\mathrm{km}\)
In week 2, every run is \(2.5\mathrm{km}\)
In week 3, every run is \(3.125\mathrm{km}\)
The distances he runs each week form a geometric progression
Solve the equation \(3 \cos \mathrm{e}^{2} \theta - 5 = 5 \cot \theta\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant \theta \leqslant 180^{\circ}\)
Solve the equation \(\sin \left(\phi + \frac{\pi}{3}\right) = -\frac{1}{2}\) , where \(\phi\) is in radians and \(-\pi \leqslant \phi \leqslant \pi\) . Give your answers in terms of \(\pi\)
